sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews Now. I'm Tecumseh Salako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: The U.S. President Joe Biden tells his Ukrainian counterpart, Vladimir Zelensky, that he'll put crippling sanctions on Russia if Moscow invades Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Rallying for democracy, a virtual summit with representatives from more than 100 countries, a meeting to discuss how to combat corruption, authoritarianism and promote human rights. And logistical issues, political instability and distrust in public institutions heavily hampers vaccination efforts in Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: U.S. President Joe Biden spoke with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on the phone

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: for more than an hour on Thursday. Biden assured Zelenskyy of support for Ukraine's sovereignty.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: He also renewed a pledge that the US and its allies would hit Russia with crippling sanctions if it did invade Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It followed a call Biden had with Russian President Vladimir Putin on Tuesday, in which Putin denounced Russophobia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I have to say that Russophobia is a first step towards genocide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: You and I know very well what is happening in Donbass. It certainly looks like genocide, like you said.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The White House's press secretary commented on Russia's reaction in a news conference.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Okay, today we have joining us our... Well, the Russians are known for their rhetorical escalations, as they are also known for their ways of providing misinformation around the world and within eastern flank countries. So I think we have to take their own efforts to communicate to the public with a grain of salt. What we know is that the aggression here is on the Russian side. The military buildup is on the Russian side. Ukraine said Zelensky was offering clear proposals to unblock the peace process and is ready to discuss them in various formats.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Democracy in the world is going in the wrong direction, US President Joe Biden told attendees at the opening of the White House Summit for Democracy. The two-day virtual event aims to promote democracy against rising autocracies. More than 100 participants, including government, civil society and private sector leaders, are in attendance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: But China and Russia have been left out, as has Hungary, the only EU member state not invited.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: as has Hungary, the only EU member state not invited.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: President Biden called on his allies to show the world that democracies are still the best option.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: By outside pressure from autocrats, they seek to advance their own power, export and expand their influence around the world and justify the repressive policies and practices as a more efficient way to address today's challenges. That's how it's sold. By voices that seek to fan the flames of social division and political polarization. And perhaps most importantly, and worrying of all, most worrying of all, by increasing the dissatisfaction of people all around the world with democratic governments that they feel are failing to deliver for their needs. European democracy is also at risk says Sam van der Starck, program head of the European region at the International Institute for Democracy and Electoral Assistance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: In high-performing democracies such as Germany and the UK you see that democracy has been eroding in some parts of its democracy, be it the involvement of citizens or how elections are run. But the more serious cases are and will stay probably for the next foreseeable future in Central and Eastern Europe. And this is a danger for Europe and the EU because you see that the rift that already existed within Europe has widened over the past years with more and more backsliders in Central and Eastern Europe that have deepened their backsliding but also expanded to countries like Slovenia that have been added to the group of backsliders. So Europe has to invest in its democracy as well both at home and abroad.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Europe has to invest in its democracy as well, both at home and abroad. The brand new German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will make his first official visit to Paris to keep with tradition and underline the Franco-German bond.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: This meeting is intended to show continuity and stability in the EU while the pandemic hits the continent and the boycott to the Winter Olympics in China is taking place.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Unlike previous summits, French President Emmanuel Macron is now the senior and will start the new year as President of the Council of the EU.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: During his press conference, Macron presented an ambitious agenda that will need the support of the new Chancellor.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Macron presented an ambitious agenda that will need the support of the new chancellor. The German Foreign Minister, Annalena Baerbock, visited Paris beforehand and expressed that Germany has no closer friend than France and said that a strong Europe needs strong German-French impulses.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Baerbock has pledged a tougher stance with authoritarian states such as Russia and China after the business-driven pragmatism of the Merkel years. On her visit to Brussels, she spoke with a high representative of the Union for Foreign Affairs, Josip Borrell, about China, Iran, Ukraine and Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Christmas lights in central London illuminated the British capital as seen across the West End.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Londoners are abiding by new COVID-19 restrictions to deal with the coronavirus variant Omicron.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Working from home and the introduction of mandatory COVID passes for crowded areas and mask wearing inside most public indoor venues are among the new measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: inside most public indoor venues are among the new measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: At least 49 migrants who were travelling crammed in a trailer died on Thursday after their vehicle collided and overturned on a motorway in southern Mexico.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Another 40 people were injured, three of them seriously, while 18 more suffered minor injuries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Three of them seriously, while 18 more suffered minor injuries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: According to the first investigations, the driver of the truck lost control due to speeding.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: Workers at a Starbucks cafe in Buffalo, New York, have voted to establish the first union at one of the coffee chain's company-owned shops in the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: A majority of staff at the company's Elmwood Avenue branch in northern New York near the Canadian border voted in favor of the union, according to online results posted by the National Labor Relations Board. Workers at two other Buffalo Starbucks cafes are also considering unionizing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The European Union has announced that it will extend the bloc's free mobile roaming rules

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: by another 10 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The Roam from Home program allows mobile phone users to make calls, send text messages and use internet in other member countries for the same price as at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The system has been in use since 2017 and was set to expire in the summer of 2022 if there had been no new agreement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Previously, using mobile phones while abroad would produce significant and sometimes unexpected costs for users as they had to pay steep prices to use the roaming functions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: As part of the deal, the EU has also said it aims to increase the quality of roaming services.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: They also said that they want to guarantee that mobile phone users are able to contact emergency services via call, text or app free of charge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The deal is currently provisional and now needs to be ratified by the EU parliament and the 27 member states.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Online retail giant Amazon has been fined a record 1.1 billion euros by Italy's antitrust authority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: It's accused the company of violating the EU's competition rules by exploiting its dominant position against independent sellers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The Italian body said Amazon had required third-party sellers to use its own logistics service called Fulfillment by Amazon, which it said was harming competitors and strengthening the giant tech's own position.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The company is also accused of preventing certain sellers from accessing the Prime loyalty service, which then barred them from taking part in events such as Black Friday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: Amazon has strongly disagreed with the decision and says it will appeal, calling the fines and remedies proposed unjustified and disproportionate the European Commission has also opened a similar investigation focusing on the entire EU the large fine comes as the EU forges ahead with antitrust litigation seeking to impose unprecedented restrictions on how us big tech giants do business.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron has dressed in his most pro-European clothes to unveil the main priorities of France's upcoming presidency of the Council of the European Union.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The EU's recovery from the pandemic will be his main priority.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Our Europe must be a Europe where we can produce, create wealth, be at the cutting edge of innovation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: But also a Europe which must defend its social model because we don't have the same collective choices as Asia or the United States.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Responding to populist governments and EU critics, Macron said they cannot be allowed to win the argument.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: There are political forces which call into question what Europe's fundamental values are.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: We must therefore think about new tools, not only sanctions, but also encouragement and support.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: There is a great deal of political work to do because we must also look at the countries which are doubting the reality or the relevance of these values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: France will take charge of the EU from the 1st of January for the next six months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But with the country's presidential election taking place in April, Macron's reign could be interrupted prematurely.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: France's European Affairs Minister says he's eyeing a deadline for a resolution on a spat

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: between France and Britain over the handling of fishing licenses in the wake of Brexit.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: It comes as Interior Minister Jarell Darmanin has called on the UK to open a legal process for migrants to enter Britain legitimately. Euronews correspondent Effie Koutsakosta has the latest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: Post-Brexit fishing rule that has pushed relations between Paris and London to breaking point is escalating with France threatening legal action against the United Kingdom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The European Commission has said the dispute over post-Brexit fishing licences must be settled by December 10.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: But the Downing Street said on Thursday that it does not recognise this deadline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: France says it is waiting for Britain to approve nearly 100 licences for its fishermen to operate in UK territorial waters and off-Jersey. Earlier on Thursday, the French Minister of the Sea had warned that if all the fishing licences still requested were not granted by Friday evening, France will ask for arbitration at EU level and will go to litigation. Last week, France's Minister for Europe was clear that retaliatory measures, including tighter customs checks, are on the table. In the meantime, technical talks will continue today and the UK's Environment Secretary is expected to hold talks with the EU Commissioner for Environment later in the day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: EU Member States are revisiting their coronavirus vaccination campaigns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Wait times between the second and third shots are being reduced across the continent as the Omicron variant continues to spread.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While England has reduced the delay before the final jab to just three months, the European vaccine regulator has approved the measure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: While the current recommendation is to administer booster preferably after six months, the data currently available support safe and effective administration of a booster as early as three months from completion of the primary vaccination should such a short interval be desirable from a public health perspective.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The World Health Organization says compulsory COVID-19 vaccines should be introduced as a last resort.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, Austria will make the jab compulsory for everyone over the age of 14 from February 2022.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: We had countless discussions in the recent weeks with youth and senior citizen representatives, with religious societies, with representatives of the healthcare professions, with scientists, with sociologists and with economists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: The tendency in all of these discussions was always clear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: We need a general vaccination requirement here in Austria to get out of this pandemic." Meanwhile in Portugal, the government has declared a state of calamity.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_16
sentences.sentence: While the country boasts one of the highest vaccination rates in the world, tighter border controls were introduced on December 1st.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Those travelling without a negative Covid test or a recovery certificate face fines of up to 800 euros.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Bulgaria has the lowest vaccination rate in the European Union, with only 25% of its population fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Logistics, political instability and distrust in public institutions are just some of the reasons slowing vaccination efforts. Our reporter Julian Lopez has travelled to Sofia to see what impact this is having.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This is one of the many rallies spontaneously organized almost every week here

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: against vaccines and the sanitary green pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: sanitary green pass.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: These vaccinations are like history is repeating itself, like in the era of World War II and the Jews. But this time, everybody is Jew. If you're not vaccinated, people start hating you.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Manufacturers are saying vaccines will remain experimental until 2023-2024.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: I don't wish to be part of an experiment.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: What are the country's political institutions doing to fight this open opposition to vaccines?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: We went to the Ministry of Health to find out.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The acting Deputy Health Minister blames the poor vaccination rate on logistical issues and on political instability.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The country has gone through three parliamentary elections in eight months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But things are improving, he claims.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The vaccination rate is now three times higher than in August.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: We expect this rate to increase four or five-fold from now until the end of December.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Do these optimistic numbers really translate on the ground?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: This is one of the capital's more active vaccination centers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It has the capacity to vaccinate up to 2,000 persons a day. Average these days is just around 700 people. I need to take care of myself. It's in my own interest.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This is my third dose. I'm not afraid of the vaccine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Getting vaccinated is not compulsory. It is needed. It's the only defence we've got.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: It is needed for me and for others too. That's what I think.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: A far-right party has just entered the new parliament with an open anti-vax programme.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The country is still coming to terms with its Covid-19 vaccination campaign.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Julianne Lopez, Euronews in Sofia, Bulgaria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: At a press conference ahead of the Nobel Peace Prize ceremony in Oslo today, this year's joint winners, journalists Maria Ressa and Dmitry Muratov, underlined the dire environment for journalists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Ressa said that governments like Duterte's in her home country of the Philippines are worse than dictators for journalists.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: It's like having a Damocles sword hung over your head.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: In some ways, it's easier to work under a dictatorship.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Working under the Suharto administration in Indonesia, for example, you know what's wrong, what is dangerous and what is not.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Now in the Philippines, the laws are there, but you exercise your rights, you tell the toughest stories at your own risk.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Muratov added that it's important to keep reporting and fighting for democracy around the globe.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Democracy needs rehabilitation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: This belief in democracy means that in time people who turn their backs on democracy will get a dictator and dictatorship leads to war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: That's the next step.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: So let's be direct.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: If we refuse democracy, we agree to war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The Norwegian Nobel Committee selected the two winners for their fight for freedom of expression in countries where reporters have faced attacks.
